title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-1.13 - Market value surveys, generally
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20 §§ 8186-1.13 - Market value surveys, generally

State Regulations
(a) Market value surveys are conducted in
order to determine the full value of taxable real property as of a valuation
date. (b) The specific details of
the procedures for conducting the surveys prior to the 1994 market survey are
set forth in Subparts 8186-24 through 8186-26 of this Part. The specific
details for conducting the surveys beginning with the 1994 market value survey
are set forth in the procedures for the survey for the appropriate valuation
year. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 20
§§
8186-1.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
